alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 2:03AM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Brandywine Creek At Chadds Ford affecting Chester and Delaware Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. For the Brandywine Creek...including Chadds Ford, Downingtown... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek below Downingtown. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. At 11.0 feet, Jefferson Avenue in Downingtown floods. Business Route 30 and Pennsylvania Avenue also flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 AM EST Thursday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.7 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 03/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 9.6 Thu 1 am 3.7 MSG 10.7 5am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM EST.
